goal_checkin_teen_data.intro_pre_goal: Here is a question to help you get started on your course:
goal_checkin_teen_data.intro_post_goal: Well done for completing the course on improving your relationship with your teen. Let‚Äôs see how things have changed since you started:
goal_checkin_teen_data.question: In the past 24 hours, did you spend at least 5 minutes of One-on-One Time with Your Teen?
goal_checkin_teen_data.response.pre_goal_positive: That is great to hear! üéâ Spending time with your teen is a great way to build a good relationship with them!
goal_checkin_teen_data.response.pre_goal_negative: That is okay. You will learn more about the importance of spending time with your teen and how to do this in this course.
goal_checkin_teen_data.response.post_goal_improved_positive: Congratulations! üéâYou‚Äôve made progress since you‚Äôve started this course in ParentText. Your effort is working!
goal_checkin_teen_data.response.post_goal_improved_negative: Congratulations on making some progress. It seems like spending time with your teen may still be a challenge.
goal_checkin_teen_data.response.post_goal_static_positive: You were already excelling at spending One-on-One Time with your teen before ParentText. It‚Äôs great that you‚Äôre able to keep up the excellent effort!
goal_checkin_teen_data.response.post_goal_static_negative: I am sorry to hear that you were unable to spend more time with your teen. üíõ
goal_checkin_teen_data.response.post_goal_worsened_positive: Time with your teen is so important. Though you are still doing great, you have reported that spending time together has become more challenging since you first began this course.
goal_checkin_teen_data.response.post_goal_worsened_negative: I am sorry to hear that you were unable to spend more time with your teen. üíõ
goal_checkin_teen_data.follow_up_positive_message: Excellent! Keep up the good work in improving your relationship with your teen
goal_checkin_teen_data.follow_up_negative_message: I am sorry to hear that One-on-One Time is not going well.
goal_checkin_teen_data.troubleshooting.question: What did you find difficult about spending time with your teen? üîë
goal_checkin_teen_data.troubleshooting.problems.1.pb: I did not have enough time.
goal_checkin_teen_data.troubleshooting.problems.1.tip:
It can be hard to find time during your day, with work, chores, and everything else. 

‚ú®Think of a time each day that you could spare 5 minutes. You can even make household chores into a game to do together. 

Use the time that you and your children are already sharing, like eating a meal or saying goodnight before bed. 

You can even make household chores into a game to do together. 

Type {PLAY} for a fun activity suggestion
goal_checkin_teen_data.troubleshooting.problems.2.pb: My teen did not want to spend One-on-One Time with me.
goal_checkin_teen_data.troubleshooting.problems.2.tip:
üòî It can hurt when Your Teen does not want to spend One-on-One Time with you. 

üí° Think to yourself: When are they more open to you? In the morning? Right before bedtime?

üíô Try again so that your teen can see that you care and want to spend this time with them.
goal_checkin_teen_data.troubleshooting.problems.3.pb: All my teen wanted to do was watch T.V. or play with a gadget.
goal_checkin_teen_data.troubleshooting.problems.3.tip:
üì∫ Teens often want to spend time watching T.V. or playing with a gadget. 

‚ùì You could watch or play on the gadget with them. 

üåà Caring about their interests is a great start!

üå∑ Once you begin spending time together, you can suggest another activity. 

Type {PLAY} for a fun activity suggestion.
goal_checkin_teen_data.troubleshooting.problems.4.pb: My teen wanted to do things I felt uncomfortable about.
goal_checkin_teen_data.troubleshooting.problems.4.tip:
üì± Sometimes your teen will suggest activities that are violent or unsafe. 

üö© Explain *why* you can't do them, and suggest a different activity. 

Type {PLAY} for a fun activity suggestion. üí°
goal_checkin_teen_data.troubleshooting.problems.5.pb: My teen wanted to do activities that I could not do.
goal_checkin_teen_data.troubleshooting.problems.5.tip:
‚òÄÔ∏è If your teen wants to do things that are too difficult for you to do, you could watch them. 

üèÅ You could describe what they are doing like a sports announcer.

You can also express enthusiasm by clapping, smiling, or giving them a thumbs-up. 

üíõ Praise them while they do it!
goal_checkin_teen_data.troubleshooting.problems.6.pb: My teen chose a competitive activity. I won, and then they got angry.
goal_checkin_teen_data.troubleshooting.problems.6.tip:
‚öΩ Competitive games can be hard for teens (and adults!) if they don‚Äôt like losing. 

üèÜ When they have calmed down, talk with your teen about what winning well and losing well might look like.

üìù Suggest other activities that you can do to work together instead of against each other.

Type {PLAY} for a fun activity suggestion. üí°
goal_checkin_teen_data.troubleshooting.problems.7.pb: All my children wanted One-on-One Time at the same time.
goal_checkin_teen_data.troubleshooting.problems.7.tip:
üî¥ It can be difficult to spend one-on-one time with each of your children when you have more than one. 

üå± If possible, you can ask an adult or older sibling to look after the other children while you spend one-on-one time with one teen.

‚è∞ Think of when it would be easier to spend one-on-one time with each of your children. Perhaps later in the evening with your teen, after the others have gone to sleep. 

üíõ You can also spend one-on-one time with all of your children at once! If you do, make sure all are able to participate in one-on-one time.

Type {PLAY} and choose GROUP for a fun activity suggestion for a group of children. üí°
goal_checkin_teen_data.troubleshooting.problems.8.tip: üíõ We are sorry to hear that you have been finding it hard to spend One-on-One Time with your teen.
goal_checkin_teen_data.conclusion: Thank you for providing a progress update. You can find and go through this course any time via the Main Menu by typing {MENU}.

goal_checkin_teen_data.intro_pre_goal: Here is a question to help you get started on your course to understand teen development:
goal_checkin_teen_data.intro_post_goal: Well done for completing your course on understanding teen development. Let‚Äôs see how things may have changed since you started this course:
goal_checkin_teen_data.question: How confident are you talking about personal things with your teen - for example, reproductive health, relationships, or sex?
goal_checkin_teen_data.response.pre_goal_positive: That is great to hear! üòÉ Talking to your teen about these topics is so important for them to be able to live a safe and healthy life.
goal_checkin_teen_data.response.pre_goal_negative: That is okay. You will learn more about the importance of talking with your teen about difficult topics and how to do this in this course.
goal_checkin_teen_data.response.post_goal_improved_positive: Congratulations! üéâYou‚Äôve made progress in this course since you‚Äôve started ParentText. Your effort is working!
goal_checkin_teen_data.response.post_goal_improved_negative: Congratulations on making some progress in this course. It seems like talking with your teen may still be a challenge.
goal_checkin_teen_data.response.post_goal_static_positive: You were already excelling at talking with your teen before ParentText. It‚Äôs great that you‚Äôre able to keep up the excellent effort!
goal_checkin_teen_data.response.post_goal_static_negative: It can be hard to talk about these things with your teen, and that‚Äôs okay. üíö
goal_checkin_teen_data.response.post_goal_worsened_positive: Talking about difficult topics with your teen is important. Though you are still doing great, you have reported that this has become more challenging since you first began ParentText.
goal_checkin_teen_data.response.post_goal_worsened_negative: It can be hard to talk about these things with your teen, and that‚Äôs okay. üíö
goal_checkin_teen_data.post_goal_positive_follow_up_question: How did talking to your teen about personal things go?
goal_checkin_teen_data.follow_up_positive_message: Excellent! Keep up the good work of talking to your teen about personal things.
goal_checkin_teen_data.follow_up_negative_message: I am sorry to hear that it has been difficult to talk to your teen about personal things
goal_checkin_teen_data.troubleshooting.question: What did you find difficult when talking to your teen about personal things? üëÇ
goal_checkin_teen_data.troubleshooting.problems.1.tip:
üò£ Talking about reproductive health, relationships, and sex can be uncomfortable - many parents feel this way! 

üòÉ Remember, these are all normal parts of life. 

üå∑ The more you talk about these topics and educate Your Teen, the more prepared they are for keeping themselves healthy and safe.
goal_checkin_teen_data.troubleshooting.problems.2.tip:
‚è∏ Teens often do not want to speak to their parents about reproductive health, relationships, and sex.

üîÑ Share that it is normal and that you also went through this.
 
üå± If they do not want to talk to you, give them resources so they can learn about the topic, or guide them on who else they can talk to for reliable information and advice. 

‚≠ê Tell your teen that you are happy to speak with them any time!
goal_checkin_teen_data.troubleshooting.problems.3.pb: I do not know where to find resources to support my teen‚Äôs development.
goal_checkin_teen_data.troubleshooting.problems.4.pb: I think my teen is too young to be talking about these things.
goal_checkin_teen_data.troubleshooting.problems.4.tip:
‚¨áÔ∏è Talking about relationships and sex from an early age reduces the chance that teens end up in dangerous or unhealthy situations!

üíö It means Your Teen knows what is safe and healthy, so they can make good choices to keep themselves safe.
goal_checkin_teen_data.troubleshooting.problems.5.tip: üíö We are sorry to hear that it has been hard to talk to your teen about sexual reproductive health, relationships, and sex.
goal_checkin_teen_data.conclusion: Thank you for providing a progress update. You can find and go through this course any time via the Main Menu by typing {MENU}. üìù

goal_checkin_child_data.intro_pre_goal: Here is a question to help you get started on your course to support your child‚Äôs development:
goal_checkin_child_data.intro_post_goal: Well done for completing your course to support your child‚Äôs development. Let‚Äôs see how things may have changed since you started this course:
goal_checkin_child_data.question: How confident are you in your ability to support your child's development?
goal_checkin_child_data.response.pre_goal_positive: That is great to hear! üòÉ Supporting your child‚Äôs development will help them live a happy, safe and healthy life.
goal_checkin_child_data.response.pre_goal_negative: That is okay. You will learn more about the importance of child development in this course. Supporting your child‚Äôs development will help them live a happy, safe and healthy life.
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_improved_positive: Congratulations! üéâYou‚Äôve made progress since you‚Äôve started ParentText. Your effort is working!
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_improved_negative: Congratulations on making some progress. It seems like supporting your child‚Äôs development may still be a challenge.
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_static_positive: You were already excelling at supporting your child‚Äôs development before ParentText. It‚Äôs great that you‚Äôre able to keep up the excellent effort!
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_static_negative: It can be difficult to support your child‚Äôs development, and that‚Äôs okay. üíõ
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_worsened_positive: Supporting your child‚Äôs development is important. Though you are still doing great, you have reported that you have become less confident since you first began ParentText.
goal_checkin_child_data.response.post_goal_worsened_negative: It can be difficult to support your child‚Äôs development, and that‚Äôs okay. üíõ
goal_checkin_child_data.post_goal_positive_follow_up_question: How are your activities to help Your Child‚Äôs development going?
goal_checkin_child_data.follow_up_positive_message: Excellent! Keep up the good work in supporting Your Child‚Äôs development.
goal_checkin_child_data.follow_up_negative_message: I am sorry to hear that your activities to help Your Child‚Äôs development are not going so well.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.question: What did you find difficult when supporting your child‚Äôs development?
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.1.pb: I don‚Äôt have time to interact with my child.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.1.tip:
üåà It is okay to feel that way. There are many small ways to spend time with your child!

‚è∞ You can interact with your child while doing something else. For example, you can ask your child to describe the colours and objects they see around them while you are walking together or travelling on a bus.

üòÉ Your child will appreciate the attention you are giving, even for a short while.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.2.pb: My child is not interested in spending time with me.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.2.tip:
üò£ You may be hurt because your child does not want to spend time with you.

‚è∞ Sometimes, your child just needs some time to start to engage with you. It helps to remain calm, patient, and kind while you try to connect with your child.

üå± As children grow, they may want independence from you. That‚Äôs normal! You can support them to find friends based on their interests.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.3.pb: My child keeps getting hurt from exploring or making new friends.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.3.tip:
üß∏ It must be hard to see your child getting injured or feeling sad often. 

üå∑Children learn and grow from making mistakes. It is an important part of child development. They will be safe as long as you are aware of their activities and you can prevent anything dangerous.

‚≠ê Build your child‚Äôs confidence about what they do, what is important to them, and how they look so that they are comfortable trying new things.

üé® Encourage them to safely try out fun activities with other children or adults. Praise them when they do it well!

üíö Let your child know that you trust them to be safe and follow the rules that you have set.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.4.pb: My child likes competitive activities but gets angry when they lose or need to share the win.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.4.tip:
‚öΩ Competitive games can be hard for children (and adults!) if they don‚Äôt like losing or sharing.

üèÜ When they have calmed down, talk with your child about what winning well and losing well might look like.

üìù Suggest other activities that you can do to work together instead of against each other.

Type {PLAY} for a fun activity suggestion. üí°
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.5.pb: My child expresses negative emotions all the time.
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.5.tip:
üíô It is difficult when your child is expressing negative feelings, but this is common because your child is also learning to manage their emotions.

üëÇ Listen to your child‚Äôs emotions and acknowledge them.

üí° Ask your child what they or you can do to help them feel better, and give your child advice on what you think would work well.

üå± While it is tempting to solve your child‚Äôs problems immediately with what you think is best, it will not help them grow. Give them a chance to come up with their own ideas!
goal_checkin_child_data.troubleshooting.problems.6.tip: üíö We are sorry to hear that it has been hard for you to understand your child‚Äôs development.
goal_checkin_child_data.conclusion: Thank you for providing your progress update. You can access this information any time in the Main Menu. üìù
